Column Comment.0: SAMPLE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample used in technical analysis.
Column Comment.1: DESCRIPTION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the description of this lithologicsample
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: LITHOLOGIC INTENSITY: Rock color intensity. The color intensity is used todescribe the amount of color associated with the sample. For example, the colorintensity may range from high to low.
Column Comment.4: LITHOLOGIC COLOR: Basic color or color adjective of lithologic components suchas red, grey, blue etc. Used in Lithology
Column Comment.5: LITHOLOGIC CONTAMINANT: A contaminant in a lithologic sample that may affectlater analysis. Drilling mud may be considered to be a contaminant.
Column Comment.6: LITHOLOGIC DEPOSITIONAL ENVIRONMENT: Type of interpreted environment ofthe deposition. A depositional environment is the physical environment in whichsediments were deposited. For example, a high-energy river channel or a carbonatebarrier reef.
Column Comment.7: LITHOLOGIC DIAGENESIS TYPE: Type of diagenesis or diagenetic mineral which isfound in the described interval. Common types of diagenesis are compaction,cementation, recrystallization or dolomitization. Diagenetic minerals may includedolomite, glauconite, olivine, etc.
Column Comment.8: ECOZONE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sedimentary rock unit or environmentin which fossil deposition occurs. Often, these ecozones are marine or fresh water.Marine ecozones include the category of marine benthic zones, namely shelf, slope,and abyssal zones. The ecozone is defined by the organisms that are found in it.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.10: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.11: LITHOLOGY: This reference table describes the major lithologic types. For examplesandstone, limestone, dolomite or shale.
Column Comment.12: OIL STAIN: the type of oil stain observed in the rock sample. For example, the oilstain can be described as fair live oil, questionable, etc
Column Comment.13: PERCENT: The percentage of hydrocarbons measured in the rock sample.
Column Comment.14: PERMEABILITY QUALIFICATION: Permeability class based on qualitative visualestimate
Column Comment.15: POROSITY TYPE: This reference table describes the type of porosity observed. Forexample intergranular, sucrosic or cavernous.
Column Comment.16: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.17: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.18: LITHOLOGIC ROCK MATRIX: Type of fine grain material filling voids between largergrains. The grained particles in a poorly sorted sedimentary rock. Matrix can be finegrained sandstone, siltstone, shale, etc.
Column Comment.19: LITHOLOGIC ROCK TYPE: Type of rock comprising a significant portion of theinterval. For example, the predominant rock type in the interval may be coal, or ooliticlimestone or calcareous sandstone.
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: STRATIGRAPHIC NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphicname set.
Column Comment.22: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
